Red Blood Cell Red blood cells have the important job of carrying oxygen. These cells pick up oxygen and deliver it to all parts of your body.
White Blood Cell White blood cells are part of the germ-fighting immune system. They are like little warriors waiting to attack invaders, like viruses and bacteria.
Platelet Your blood contains many tiny cells called platelets. They help your blood clot, which means that if you get a cut, they stick together to stop bleeding.
